question.title: Putting Android into airplane mode with adb hack
question.body:
With Macrodroid, adb shell pm grant com.arlosoft.macrodroid android.permission.WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS can put it into airplane mode when you give this permission. My code

boolean isEnabled = Settings.Global.getInt(context.getContentResolver(), Settings.Global.AIRPLANE_MODE_ON, 0) == 1; Settings.Global.putInt(context.getContentResolver(), Settings.Global.AIRPLANE_MODE_ON, isEnabled ? 0 : 1);

In my own application, when I give that permission, I can change the settings to airplane mode, but when I publish the intent state change, I get permission denied.

Intent intent = new Intent(Intent.ACTION_AIRPLANE_MODE_CHANGED); intent.putExtra("state", !isEnabled); context.sendBroadcast(intent);

How can Macrodroid do this?

Toggle airplane mode
